definitions.definition: a metal container in which food is sold; the contents of one of these containers

examples.text: Open the tin and drain the tuna.
Next, add two tins of tomatoes.

definitions.definition: a metal container with a lid (= cover), in the shape of a cylinder, in which paint, glue, etc. is sold and stored; the contents of one of these containers

examples.text: The bedroom needed three tins of paint *(= in order to paint it)*.

definitions.definition: a metal container with a lid (= cover) used for keeping food in

examples.text: Store the seeds in an airtight tin.

definitions.definition: a metal container used for cooking food in
a chemical element. Tin is a soft silver-white metal that is often mixed with other metals or used to cover them to prevent them from rusting.

used to say that something is as good or effective as it claims to be, or that it really does what it claims to do. This expression is especially used when you are comparing advertisements with actual products.

examples.text: I paid £150 for this camera and am more than happy with it. It does exactly what it says on the tin!
She was like a cat on a hot tin roof before her driving test.

wordOrigin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tin and German Zinn.
